Title__c: BQA-10550 Sales Tax Reclass: Mismatched SubProject/Activity (Labor) and Cost Element (Material)
BMCServiceDesk__shortDescription__c:
Description

As a Finance IFS User

I am seeking a proper cost classification of out of state sales tax classification so 

So i can properly state project costs in order to properly state costs and subsequently recognize the appropriate amount of r
BMCServiceDesk__incidentDescription__c:
Description

As a Finance IFS User

I am seeking a proper cost classification of out of state sales tax classification so 

So i can properly state project costs in order to properly state costs and subsequently recognize the appropriate amount of revenues.

Business Requirements Overview

Transferring INC35311067 to a CRIM Please refer to the ticket for more details.

Business Background:

Therma does business with California based Suppliers and out of state Suppliers. Legally, Therma is required to pay Sales Tax to the California State Franchise Tax Board for any purchases from out of state vendors. Complicating matters, an out of state vendor may or may not be legally required to collect California sales tax from Therma.

Natively, there is no standard capability in IFS to transact the proper account for Out of State Sales Taxes. Project Costs (Acct #5801) should include the Sales Tax Component as this represents a legitimate Project Cost.


The intent of this CRIM is to solve this challenge in a two-step process:

1. Run this report in Power BI to generate the necessary output that will be utilized to create the journal entry.

2. Utilize the output (from the PowerBI) to upload into IFS to create a manual Journal Entry.

The intent is to reclass Sales Tax Expenses that have originally been debited to Account #2306 to Account #5801 (inclusive of a Project Number). Furthermore, the reclass should credit those transactions credited to Account #5801 without a Project and to debit Account #5801 with a project number.

Description

The need has been identified to provide a search field to look up vendor/suppliers by nickname or abbreviated name. This will help with the filed users being able to locate the correct vendor/supplier by common names used in the field as we
BMCServiceDesk__incidentDescription__c:
Description

The need has been identified to provide a search field to look up vendor/suppliers by nickname or abbreviated name. This will help with the filed users being able to locate the correct vendor/supplier by common names used in the field as well as in the office.

Title__c: BQA-10410 Incorrect resource entry results in no pay for employees.  Decision required as to change
BMCServiceDesk__shortDescription__c:
Description

Rate agreements have optional plans that contain cost type of 'BASIC' so if a resource is entered that is not part of the employees default rate agreement, the application finds an alternate basic wage rate in the voluntary plan and that ra
BMCServiceDesk__incidentDescription__c:
Description

Rate agreements have optional plans that contain cost type of 'BASIC' so if a resource is entered that is not part of the employees default rate agreement, the application finds an alternate basic wage rate in the voluntary plan and that rate does not have a 'REG' wage code for the employees true base wage.
Original Caller: Dan Bach
Original Incident: INC34089393

Business Requirements Overview

IFS must identify the issue. Catch error proactively (preventive) before failure. Not large volume but needs to be addressed soon to eliminate manual overhead.

BMCServiceDesk__incidentDescription__c:
Description

Fabrication is not seeing any summary for Cost Type “Personnel” on the Work Order “Budget” page.  It also not on the “Summary” tab of the Work Task.  We need this to be resolved so that we can properly evaluate for billing purposes, as well as evaluate Work Orders for profitability.

Title__c: BQA-10536 Manufactured Parts placed into inventory: Process change & possible tech enhancement
BMCServiceDesk__shortDescription__c:
Description

Rutterkey recommended the following procedure, which is both time consuming and not practical:

For each Part, and each production run of that part, create a Work Order.

Issue the raw materials required to accommodate that run of finis
BMCServiceDesk__incidentDescription__c:
Description

Rutterkey recommended the following procedure, which is both time consuming and not practical:

For each Part, and each production run of that part, create a Work Order.

Issue the raw materials required to accommodate that run of finished goods to the Work Order.

Charge time required to accommodate that run of finished goods to the Work Order.

Close the Work Order when the pre-determined quantity has been met.

“Receive Inventory Part” on the pre-determined quantity.

Business Requirements Overview

Due to multiple factors beyond our control (time constraints at go-live especially), we have not been following this procedure. It has since gotten out of hand.
30-01 has been manually counting in parts to accommodate the issuance of material of the finished goods on Work Orders, without creating the Work Order portion of the guidance. -- this is why you see COUNT-IN transactions on these parts.
30-02 has been performing the “Receive Inventory Part” portion of the guidance as the finished goods are manufactured, without creating the Work Order portion of the guidance. -- this is why you see NREC transactions on these parts.

For both 30-01 and 30-02, the raw materials needed to satisfy the production runs are not being issued in any capacity. The inventory quantities are reconciled at the time of the annual inventory count.
For both 30-01 and 30-02, the labor required to satisfy the production runs has been applied to a single overhead Work Order, mixed in with other overhead work.

Example: Spiral Elbows are made on a universal overhead number and placed into inventory. This information is not being reported to me, but I know that we are continuing to fully stock those parts on a daily basis. As I progress through the inventory issuing process, I may see that one of these items has a zero count in IFS. I will manually count in an estimated amount of parts (usually 100 at a time) which gives me enough to satisfy several Work Orders.

The Fabrication team recommends a sit down with Finance AND a Hoist specialist with experience in part structures so that we can revise the procedure.

Title: Therma Projects Summary Lobby - "Projects to Update" Tile layout changes + validating the planned cost source

This Jira should address following 2 points,
1) Validation of “Planned Cost” source in “Projects to Update” tile in Therma Projects Su
BMCServiceDesk__incidentDescription__c:
Title: Therma Projects Summary Lobby - "Projects to Update" Tile layout changes + validating the planned cost source

This Jira should address following 2 points,
1) Validation of “Planned Cost” source in “Projects to Update” tile in Therma Projects Summary Lobby. As per @Michael Oshaughnessy this should ideally pull data from “Project Definition” > “Margin” tab > “Planned Cost” and should not in any way refer to the “Planned Cost” in the Project Monitoring page which is equivalent to the “Estimated Cost” in Legence case, since the “Planned Cost Driver” is Estimated Cost. 
 
  a) Functional Validation - @Sachitha DeSilva 
  b) Technical Validation - @Matt Conk 

2) Adjust the layout of the “Projects to Update” tile in Therma Projects Summary Lobby, so that two columns displayed are easy to read with some space in between. 

Business Requirements Overview

None

Title__c: BQA-10399 Process gap: Contract jobs being billed prior to JRM and payroll
BMCServiceDesk__shortDescription__c:

Results in inaccurate job cost and inability to pay employee for these hours.

Mitigation is being handled by payroll correction process, which is ti
BMCServiceDesk__incidentDescription__c:
Finance team will create invoices for contract jobs prior to running JRM or payroll for employee time.
Results in inaccurate job cost and inability to pay employee for these hours.

Mitigation is being handled by payroll correction process, which is time intensive and results in employee being paid late.

Requirements must be clearly identified and a cross-functional solution determined.
Original Caller: Sarah Rust
Original Incident: INC34100856
